importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication, marking the day Ange Postecoglou was dismissed from Nottingham Forest after just 39 days as manager.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The timeframe of the manager's dismissal and immediate aftermath, highlighting the unprecedented speed of the exit in Premier League history.

keyTakeAways: Ange Postecoglou was dismissed by Nottingham Forest after just 39 days as manager, the fastest exit in Premier League history.
Postecoglou failed to win any games during his tenure, drawing two and losing six, including a 3-0 defeat to Chelsea.
The dismissal occurred just hours after the match against Chelsea, and the club stated the decision was due to 'disappointing results and performances'.
Postecoglou joined after Nuno Espírito Santo, who had led the club to its best league finish in 30 years (7th place in 2024/25), was fired early in the season.
The Australian manager was booed by fans at the end of the match, reflecting fan dissatisfaction with his leadership.
This marks the third managerial change at Nottingham Forest in the current season, signaling instability in club leadership.
Sam Allardyce is the only permanent manager in Premier League history to have a shorter tenure than Postecoglou’s, though it was not a permanent appointment.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Ange Postecoglou, the Australian football manager, was abruptly dismissed by Nottingham Forest after just 39 days in charge, following a 3-0 defeat to Chelsea and a record of zero wins, two draws, and six losses. This marks the fastest managerial exit in Premier League history, surpassing even Les Reed's 40-day tenure at Charlton. The decision comes after a turbulent period, including the early departure of Nuno Espírito Santo, who had led the club to its best finish in 30 years. Fan discontent, particularly after booing at the final match, and reported tensions with club owner Evangelos Marinakis contributed to the instability. The club is now searching for its third manager of the season, reflecting ongoing leadership challenges.
title: Nottingham Forest manager Ange Postecoglou fired after just 39 days at Premier League club
